p.s: Drawing on the computer is hard , but an oekaki ( doodling and painting program ) can make it more simple than it appears .
This can help you use an oekaki so you can stop using that horrible MS-Paint !

list.item: Find an oekaki that seems fitting to your level .

item.s: Go to draw , if that is what it is under .
Pick out which program you want to use .
Shi-painter is a tricky one , but in a way it 's easy .
In Shi-painter , you can have a rainbow of colors that you pick out , and you have a new tool called pen .
Pen makes it seem like a real pencil drawing .
If you get the hang out this , then try Shi-painter Pro .
If Shi-painter is n't for you , try PaintBBS .
Palette is good for it because it gives you more colors .
OekakiBBS is a good one , and it has a different way of sizing the point of the pen .
Usually , oekakiBBS wo n't allow you to submit your art , so I would avoid using this one .
Pick whatever one you want , and start sketching .
For sketching , use a different color other than black .
Such as , for the eyes use orange , or for the head use green .
Switch colors often so you will know where a part ends .
Now go over the lines with a darker color , or just use black .
Add detail .
Color using And or Div.

list.item:
If you feel like you are finished send it .
Type out a comment about your drawing , and type out a title .

item.s: Ask for crits if you want to improve .
If you want to find an oekaki of your level , and are a beginner , go to an oekaki without try-outs .
Suta Raito Sketch oekaki is a good one , and so is EP oekaki .
If someone says such things as , ' Your art sucks !
' do n't let it get to you !
If you want ' crits ' then say so , but if you do n't say so too , because in a normal oekaki they WILL give crits .
The bezier tool helps !

list.item: Get your own style , so people notice you !

item.s: If you want help on your figure for drawing , ask for a redline .
Mask is good for going over lines in black .
And is good for coloring , and so on .
These are simple tools .
If you feel as though your drawing is n't great , then do n't send it !
But if you really want to do .
You can Safety save , or S.S. your unfinished works .
If you are trying out for a normal or advanced oekaki and are just a beginner in oekakis , then you should wait , because they will crit you .
If you spam , you will have a warning .
Crits can be harsh !

list.item: Sometimes your drawing might close , so use PRT SCR ( print screen ) button often !
Your artwork might get bumped off quickly , so save it !
